summary: IAV2 is a common pathogen that causes respiratory tract infections and acute severe pneumonia. in response to viral infection, the host produces chemokines, proinflammatory cytokines, and immunoregulatory cytokines. the role of other cytokines or chemokines have also been investigated. IL-27 is composed of the T-cell cytokine receptor (TCCR/WSX-1) and the signal transducer glycoprotein 130. IL-27 activates the JAK-STAT signaling pathway, which drives rapid clonal expansion of naive but not memory CD4+ T cells. IL-27 synergizes with IL-12 to trigger IFN- production of naive CD4+ T cells. IL-27 is significantly up-regulated in IAV-infected lung epithelial cells and freshly isolated PBMCs. we also show that IAV triggers IL-27/EBI3 promoter activity and IL-27 expression through a protein kinase A (PKA)-CREB signaling pathway. circulating IL-27 levels are closely associated with PGE2 levels.
